body_html:
How do I verify if XLA is invoked or see which ops are compiled via XLA? I only see LaunchOpHasKernelForDevice kernel_class_name: XlaLocalLaunchOp in the log.

Also, I was expecting to see send/recv ops between /job:ps/replica:0/task:0/device:CPU:0 and /job:worker/replica:0/task:0/device:XLA_CPU:0, but that's not the case.
body_text:
How do I verify if XLA is invoked or see which ops are compiled via XLA? I only see LaunchOpHasKernelForDevice kernel_class_name: XlaLocalLaunchOp in the log.
Also, I was expecting to see send/recv ops between /job:ps/replica:0/task:0/device:CPU:0 and /job:worker/replica:0/task:0/device:XLA_CPU:0, but that's not the case.
body:
How do I verify if XLA is invoked or see which ops are compiled via XLA? I only see `LaunchOpHasKernelForDevice kernel_class_name: XlaLocalLaunchOp` in the log.

Also, I was expecting to see send/recv ops between `/job:ps/replica:0/task:0/device:CPU:0` and `/job:worker/replica:0/task:0/device:XLA_CPU:0`, but that's not the case.
